channel.title: USPTO Patent Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO Patent events.

item.title: Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions found on the DOCX filing series page. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part II: Drafting provisional patent applications
item.description: In part two of this eight-part recurring series, United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts discuss key differences between provisional and nonprovisional patent applications, filing requirements and fees, the different ways to file a provisional application, and more.

item.title: Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions found on the DOCX filing series page. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center and EFS-Web during any of several free upcoming training sessions found on the DOCX filing series page. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part III: Patent searching
item.description: Are you interested in learning more about patent searching?

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part IV: Learn how to draft a patent application
item.description: Understanding patent application drafting is a vital step in protecting your invention. In part four of this eight-part recurring series, United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts will discuss the formalities and requirements of drafting a patent application, as well as how to avoid common mistakes.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part V: Understanding the role of claims in a patent application
item.description: Are you an inventor preparing to file a patent application? In part five of this eight-part recurring series, United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts will discuss the parts of the claim, show examples of claim illustrations from issued U.S. patents, and help participants develop a better appreciation of how a patent examiner views a claim.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part VI: Learn how to protect your IP abroad
item.description: Did you know that patents offer territorial rights, meaning that there is no such thing as an international or global patent? Learn how to help protect your intellectual property (IP) in foreign jurisdictions.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part VII: How to file a patent application using Patent Center
item.description: Looking for more information on using Patent Center? In part seven of this eight-part recurring series, United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts will teach participants how to use this tool to file and manage patent documents online.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part VIII: Common mistakes and post-filing support
item.description: Are you an inventor? Join us for this session full of important tips on filing a patent application and what to do after you file for a patent.
